about_the_game:
ENVGUARD

Game Description:
Gain environmental awareness in a fun and educational way with Recycling Heroes! Specifically designed for primary and middle school students, in this game, you compete in two teams at Izmit 30 August Primary School, collecting recyclable waste.

Game Features:
- Teamwork and Strategy: Divide into two teams within the school and collect the most waste to place in recycling bins. Collaborate with your teammates to score the highest points!

- Various Recycling Bins: Reinforce environmental awareness by sorting waste into categorized recycling bins.

- Rewards and Store: Earn extra points for each piece of waste you collect and use these points to purchase various tools from the in-game store:
- Garbage Bag: Grants an extra inventory slot.
- Rubber Gloves: Allows faster waste collection.
- Running Shoes: Enables faster movement.
- Special Waste Compass: Shows the locations of specially spawned waste.

Education and Fun Combined:

Recycling Heroes not only instills recycling awareness in students but also develops teamwork and strategic thinking skills. It encourages them to continue these behaviors in real life. Have fun and contribute to the environment at the same time!

Are you ready? Become a recycling hero and take steps to protect the environment!

name: Envguard

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10, Windows 11
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 1500X, Intel Core i7-4770K
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon RX 550, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10, Windows 11
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5500, Intel Core İ5-11400H
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2060, AMD Radeon RX 6500 XT
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

short_description: The aim of Envguard is to instill environmental awareness in students in a fun and effective way. Competing in two teams at Izmit 30 August Primary School, players collect recyclable waste and perform strategic tasks that encourage environmentally friendly behavior.
